company.tap.gosellapi.internal.utils

Class DateValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.tap.gosellapi.internal.utils.DateValidator

  • public class DateValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class provided as a convenience to ExpirationDateEditText to make testing easier.

    • Field Detail

      • MAXIMUM_VALID_YEAR_DIFFERENCE

        public static final int MAXIMUM_VALID_YEAR_DIFFERENCE
        Maximum amount of years in advance that a credit card expiration date should be trusted to be valid. This is mostly used if the current date is towards the end of the century and the expiration date is at the start of the following one.

        Ex. Current year is 2099, Expiration date is "01/01". The YY is "less than" the current year, but since the difference is less than MAXIMUM_VALID_YEAR_DIFFERENCE, it should still be trusted to be valid client-side.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INSTANCE

        private static final DateValidator INSTANCE

      • mCalendar

        private final java.util.Calendar mCalendar

    • Constructor Detail

      • DateValidator

        protected DateValidator(java.util.Calendar calendar)
        Used in tests to inject a custom Calendar to stabilize dates. Normal usage will just delegate to the actual date.
        Parameters:
        calendar - the calendar

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(java.lang.String month,
                              java.lang.String year)
        Helper for determining whether a date is a valid credit card expiry date.
        Parameters:
        month - Two-digit month
        year - Two or four digit year
        Returns:
        Whether the date is a valid credit card expiry date.

      • isValidHelper

        protected boolean isValidHelper(java.lang.String monthString,
                                java.lang.String yearString)
        Is valid helper boolean.
        Parameters:
        monthString - the month string
        yearString - the year string
        Returns:
        the boolean

      • getCurrentMonth

        private int getCurrentMonth()
        Calendar.MONTH is 0-prefixed. Add 1 to align it with visualized expiration dates.

      • getCurrentTwoDigitYear

        private int getCurrentTwoDigitYear()
        Calendar.YEAR is the full, 4-digit year. Take the trailing two digits to align it with visualized expiration dates.
